account.note:
🌏 Born at 312 PPM

Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses The scientific consensus is that 2 degrees of warming is enough to trigger posit
ive feedback loops, (hence the Paris 1.5 degree limit) after which there is no way of saving the climate. So after having reached 2 degrees, we can just wait for more.

@breadandcircuses Give it a year, we'll be talking about 5°C and #SecondImpact level flooding.

#ClimateChange #ClimateCrisis

account.note:
It almost feels a bit exotic but - no, I never had an account on that “birdsite”, even though I like birds. Simply came here and loved it! When the server I first signed up on was shut down, I set up this little instance of one.
Chicken keeper, dog lover, photo enthusiast without decent camera, would-be-smallholder-if-only-I-had-more-time, ex-beekeeper, seed saver, writer, publisher. Curious, enthusiastic, believe in the power of kindness.

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses
This means two, maybe three billion people currently live in regions that will become uninhabitable.

This will cause the largest migration in human history, and most of that will be people migrating as refugees.

We treat refugees inhumanely now. I don't even want to imagine how cruel we'll be when that wave of migration crests.

descendants.content:
@jozeldenrust @breadandcircuses
If your country - your entire continent - was turned uninhabitable by the global North, and that same North was still able to support life (to some extent) and you were half a billion strong... would you go there as a refugee?
I know I, for one, wouldn't be asking nicely.

@breadandcircuses
Why are humans so bad at choosing leaders who focus on the wrong things? At this time it really doesn't matter that Ukraine used to be part of the Russian empire or whose grandparents had the better claim on a Palestinian olive grove. China threatening Taiwan or North Korea threatening everyone really isn't going to solve anything. Yet these are the things our leaders worry about and spend our money on.
@Walrus

descendants.content:
@AlfredJH @breadandcircuses There is nobody ultimately in charge here. What you see is an emergent result of many individual decisions, most of them selfish.

No nation is going to sacrifice its prosperity for the planet, and if they try their leaders will be toppled. There is already a lot of backtracking because of minor increases in energy prices.

This gets fixed when the new energy tech is decisively better than the old, and not before that.

Even if we stop using carbon fuels 100% today, it's likely processes already begun will create a global temperature rise of 2 degrees C.
